 I hear McCain might run again. Bill Frist as well.
 
 I think Condi Rice would be a great pick, but I think she may have also said she was not going to at this point.

I read quite a bit of American news - always good to know what the elephant on the continent is up to. Depending on the media outlet, Bush was either praised, or was made fun of. Nobody seemed interested in making an intelligent critique of his policies, or discussing his performance as President (possibly because he's done a rather good job). Plenty of people were willing to point out that the Emperor had no clothes, and many were content to be the 'royal fart catchers' but none were willing to discuss his job performance. To be honest I found more critical discussion of his policies in the foreign media.

 
 I think it is probably because many people here ae pretty much aware of his policies--there's little need for the media to have to rehash them. People tend to make up their minds. Nevertheless I have heard his policies discussed in the media many times. American press tries to put on an objective front, although they usually aren't very successful.
